title: Demi Moore reportedly says Ashton Kutcher used their threesomes as an excuse for infidelity
text:
More revelations about Demi Moore's eight-year marriage with Ashton Kutcher are emerging ahead of the release of her memoir, "Inside Out."

According to the gossip site Radar Online, Moore wrote in the book that she and Kutcher engaged in two threesomes during their relationship, calling them a "mistake."

"I wanted to show him how great and fun I could be," Moore — who is 15 years Kutcher's senior — reportedly wrote.

Read more: Demi Moore blamed herself for miscarrying her baby with Ashton Kutcher, and says it reignited her drinking problem

According to Radar Online, Moore wrote that she learned Kutcher had cheated on her with a woman he had met while bowling with her daughter Rumer Willis, which she called a "real f--- you."

Stefanie Keenan / Getty

Moore reportedly wrote that when she confronted Kutcher, he used their threesomes to excuse his behavior: "Because we had brought a third party into our relationship, Ashton said, that blurred the lines and, to some extent, justified what he'd done."

Citing her memoir, Radar Online said the pair separated in 2011 after Moore learned via a Google alert that Kutcher had cheated on her again.

"I felt sick to my stomach," she reportedly wrote. "I knew she wasn't lying."

The couple divorced in 2013. Insider has contacted HarperCollins and representatives of Kutcher and Moore for comment.

Last week, extracts of "Inside Out" shared by The New York Times, which also interviewed Moore, revealed that the actress said she was raped at 15.

"When I was younger, I was obligated to be of service," she told The Times. "I wouldn't be loved if I wasn't — if I didn't give of myself. My value was tied into my body."

She also said that she blamed herself for miscarrying her and Kutcher's baby and that it drove her to abuse alcohol again.

"Inside Out" is scheduled to be released by Harper on Tuesday.
description: More revelations about Demi Moore's eight-year marriage with Ashton Kutcher are emerging ahead of the release of her memoir, "Inside Out."
